title: Crusty Broiled Tuna Steaks
introduction: Enjoy the delightful crunch of bread crumbs on these perfectly broiled tuna steaks. Combine fresh herbs with savory bread crumbs to create a crust that pairs beautifully with juicy tuna or swordfish. This easy-to-make dish promises a fine dining experience at home.
ingredients: 4 (1 inch thick) tuna or swordfish steaks
1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint or 1 teaspoon dried oregano
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Preheat the broiler. Oil the broiler pan. In a bowl, toss together the bread crumbs, parsley, mint, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in 3 tablespoons of the oil, or enough to moisten the crumbs.
Arrange the fish steaks on the broiler pan. Scatter half of the crumbs on top of the fish, patting them in.

Broil the steaks about 6 inches from the flame for 3 minutes, or until the crumbs are browned. Carefully turn the steaks with a metal spatula and sprinkle with the remaining crumbs. Broil 2 to 3 minutes more or until still pink in the center, or until done to taste. Test for doneness by making a small cut in the thickest part of the fish.
Drizzle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Serve hot, with lemon wedges.
